## What is CSS?

-   Cascading Style Sheets (CSS)
-   Language that allows us to style HTML elements

## Why did I want to use it for my website?

-   I wanted to have more control over things like spacing and fontsize for individual elements

## Before

<img src="websiteOG.png" height="500" width="900"/>

## I set out to:

\- Customize the font size for each element

\- Change the size and spacing of the navigation bar

\- Fix the spacing on the front page

## How did I use it?

In the YAML of my website I added this line:

``` yaml
format:
  html:
    css: styles.css
```

And created a file called styles.css in the same project that my website is hosted.

## Customizing font size

``` css
body {
    font-size: 20px; 
}
```

Now everything within the HTML `<body>` element is 20px.

## Changing the size of the navigation bar

``` css
/* Make the navbar taller */
.navbar, .site-navbar {
  height: 80px;               
  align-items: center;        
}

/* Adjust top-level links to fit taller navbar */
.navbar .nav-link {
  padding-top: 0.8rem;        /* add padding */
  padding-bottom: 0.8rem;
}

/* Adjust dropdown items to make them taller too */
.navbar .dropdown-menu .dropdown-item {
  padding-top: 0.7rem;
  padding-bottom: 0.7rem;
}
```

## Changing the font size of the navigation bar

``` css
/* Top-level navbar items */
.navbar .nav-link {
  font-size: 1.4\rem;
}

/* Dropdown menu items */
.navbar .dropdown-menu .dropdown-item {
  font-size: 1.15rem;
}
```

## Sizing the home screen

``` css
/* Title at top of page */
.quarto-title h1.title {
  font-size: 2.6rem;  
  font-weight: 700;
}

/* About section text */
.about-contents {
  font-size: 1.15rem;  
}

/* section title (Education, About Me) */
.about-contents h2 {
  font-size: 1.6rem;
  font-weight: 600;
}
```

Note: The unit "rem" assigns the size relative to the base font-size defined in the `<html>` element
